Log4j 1.3alpha-8

Uses of Interface
org.apache.log4j.spi.RepositorySelector

Packages that use RepositorySelector
org.apache.log4j The main log4j package. 
org.apache.log4j.selector This package contains classes useful for working with Log4j in a container environment where many applications need to share Log4j without stepping on each other's logging configuration. 
org.apache.log4j.spi Contains part of the System Programming Interface (SPI) needed to extend log4j. 
 

Uses of RepositorySelector in org.apache.log4j
 

Methods in org.apache.log4j that return RepositorySelector
static RepositorySelector LogManager.getRepositorySelector()
          Return the repository selector currently in use.
 

Methods in org.apache.log4j with parameters of type RepositorySelector
static void LogManager.setRepositorySelector(RepositorySelector selector, Object guard)
          Sets RepositorySelector but only if the correct guard is passed as parameter.
 

Uses of RepositorySelector in org.apache.log4j.selector
 

Classes in org.apache.log4j.selector that implement RepositorySelector
 class ContextJNDISelector
          Defines a unique logger repository for each web-application in a J2EE environment.
 

Uses of RepositorySelector in org.apache.log4j.spi
 

Subinterfaces of RepositorySelector in org.apache.log4j.spi
 interface RepositorySelectorEx
          The LogManager uses one (and only one) RepositorySelector implementation to select the LoggerRepository for a particular application context.
 

Classes in org.apache.log4j.spi that implement RepositorySelector
 class DefaultRepositorySelector
